column4: I can't Smeg to run.  I have run it but when I click on it in the menu, a taskbar entry comes up as "Starting Smeg Menu Editor" and then goes away
Try running it from a terminal to see if there are any messages
Have a look in /usr/share/applications for the file that has the bad entry
thx
yw :)
no its not in there.  It looks like none of the ones I added with Smeg are in that folder
Hmm.  You could search for it using find ...
tried that :-s
k. I'm starting to struggle now.  I thought smeg managed entries in that dir
ok.  I don't even know why Smeg would allow you to create an invalid entry that then would cause it to not start
Ooh - have a look in ~/.local/share/applications/
yay! its in there. let's see if when I delete it, it gets fixed....
You're right - it's a bug I'd say - smeg is fairly new
it must be saved in an smeg file somewhere because not it complains about it being in a file...
File "<string>", line 6
that didn't print well.  the caret goes under the s in America's.  So presumably, its the apostrophe messing it up
You could try searching for the file with "grep -r America *" in ~/.local
failing that - in the whole filesystem
will do
Applications -> System Tools -> New Login
yeah, but is there a way to switch between the two once I have created a second?
then ctrl-alt-f7 will be the first login and ctrl-alt-f8 will be the second
oh ok thx
oops, misread your question.  But got there anyway :)
